articles.basic_headline: Datadog President Amit Agarwal to step down, shares drop
articles.title: Datadog President Amit Agarwal to step down, shares drop
articles.description: Datadog President Amit Agarwal will step down by the end of 2024 and join the company's board of directors, the cybersecurity firm said on Tuesday, sending its shares down nearly 9% in early trading.
articles.web: Datadog President Amit Agarwal to step down, shares drop

articles.basic_headline: Google trial wraps up as judge weighs landmark US antitrust claims
articles.title: Google trial wraps up as judge weighs landmark US antitrust claims
articles.description: Google and the U.S. Justice Department wrapped up closing arguments on Friday over claims that the Alphabet unit has unlawfully dominated web search and related advertising, in a case the government contends could shape the “future of the internet.”
articles.web: Google trial wraps up as judge weighs landmark US antitrust claims

articles.basic_headline: Exclusive: Johnson Controls weighs sale of ADT alarms unit, sources say
articles.title: Exclusive: Johnson Controls weighs sale of ADT alarms unit, sources say
articles.description: Johnson Controls International is considering the sale of its ADT alarms business as it offloads some non-core businesses, three people familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.web: Johnson Controls weighs sale of ADT alarms unit, sources say

articles.basic_headline: Apple unveils record $110 billion buyback as results beat low expectations
articles.title: Apple unveils record $110 billion buyback as results beat low expectations
articles.description: Apple's quarterly results and forecast beat modest expectations on Thursday, as the iPhone maker unveiled a record share buyback program, sending its stock up 6% in extended trade.
articles.web: Apple unveils record $110 billion buyback as results beat low expectations

articles.basic_headline: US judge questions Google, DOJ in market power trial closing
articles.title: US judge questions Google, DOJ in market power trial closing
articles.description: U.S. District Judge Amit Mehta peppered the Justice Department and Alphabet's Google with questions during the first day of closing arguments in the government's antitrust lawsuit against the online search leader.
articles.web: US judge questions Google, DOJ in market power trial closing

articles.basic_headline: Apple unveils record $110 billion buyback as results beat low expectations
articles.title: Apple unveils record $110 billion buyback as results beat low expectations
articles.description: Apple's quarterly results and forecast beat modest expectations on Thursday, as the iPhone maker unveiled a record share buyback program, sending its stock up almost 7% in extended trade.
articles.web: Apple unveils record $110 billion buyback as results beat low expectations

articles.basic_headline: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix says HBM chips almost sold out for 2025
articles.title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix says HBM chips almost sold out for 2025
articles.description: South Korea's SK Hynix said on Thursday that its high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips used in AI chipsets were sold out for this year and almost sold out for 2025 as businesses aggressively expand artificial intelligence services.
articles.web: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix says HBM chips almost sold out for 2025

thumbnail.caption: Employee walks past the logo of SK Hynix at its headquarters in Seongnam, South Korea, April 25, 2016. REUTERS/Kim Hong-Ji/File Photo

thumbnail.subtitle: Employee walks past the logo of SK Hynix at its headquarters in Seongnam

articles.basic_headline: Qualcomm forecast beats estimates as AI drives chip sales in China
articles.title: Qualcomm forecast beats estimates as AI drives chip sales in China
articles.description: Qualcomm on Wednesday forecast quarterly sales and adjusted profit above Wall Street expectations, driven by selling more and pricier chips into Android smartphones with artificial-intelligence features.
articles.web: Qualcomm forecast beats estimates as AI drives chip sales in China

thumbnail.caption: A woman walks past a counter displaying mobile phones at the Qualcomm booth during the 2021 China International Fair for Trade in Services (CIFTIS) in Beijing, China September 4, 2021. REUTERS/Florence Lo/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: 2021 China International Fair for Trade in Services (CIFTIS) in Beijing
thumbnail.subtitle: 2021 China International Fair for Trade in Services (CIFTIS) in Beijing

articles.basic_headline: Apple set for big sales decline as investors await AI in iPhones
articles.title: Apple set for big sales decline as investors await AI in iPhones
articles.description: Apple's plan to add generative AI to its iPhones and revive sagging sales in the crucial Chinese market will be in focus on Thursday, when the tech giant is expected to report its biggest quarterly revenue decline in more than a year.
articles.web: Apple set for big sales decline as investors await AI in iPhones

thumbnail.caption: People look at the new iPhone 15 as Apple's new iPhone 15 officially goes on sale across China, at an Apple store in Shanghai, China September 22, 2023. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo
thumbnail.alt_text: Apple's new iPhone 15 officially goes on sale across China
thumbnail.subtitle: Apple's new iPhone 15 officially goes on sale across China

articles.basic_headline: Skyworks forecasts third-quarter revenue below estimates
articles.title: Skyworks forecasts third-quarter revenue below estimates
articles.description: Apple supplier Skyworks Solutions forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Tuesday on demand concerns, as clients struggle to offload excess inventory, sending its shares down 6% in extended trading.
articles.web: Skyworks forecasts third-quarter revenue below estimates

articles.basic_headline: Corning forecasts second-quarter core sales above estimates on steady carrier spending
articles.title: Corning forecasts second-quarter core sales above estimates on steady carrier spending
articles.description: Specialty glass maker Corning forecast second-quarter core sales above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, banking on price increases and healthy demand for its fiber optic cables amid recovery in spending from telecom clients.
articles.web: Corning forecasts second-quarter core sales above estimates on steady carrier spending

articles.basic_headline: No joke as Kid Karam eyes breaking new ground in Paris
articles.title: No joke as Kid Karam eyes breaking new ground in Paris
articles.description: Weeks before his eighth birthday, Karam Singh joked about becoming a break dancer while watching a Justin Timberlake video and, 16 years on, Kid Karam is preparing for the Paris 2024 Olympics.
articles.web: No joke as Kid Karam eyes breaking new ground in Paris

thumbnail.caption: British breaker Karam Singh performs during a Reuters interview on the sidelines of the inauguration of the Samsung Galaxy innovation space on the Champs-Elysees avenue in Paris, France, April 29, 2024. REUTERS/Benoit Tessier

thumbnail.subtitle: British breaker Karam Singh shows off moves in Paris ahead of Olympics

articles.basic_headline: Samsung says AI to drive technology demand in second half after strong Q1
articles.title: Samsung says AI to drive technology demand in second half after strong Q1
articles.description: Samsung Electronics forecast demand for artificial intelligence would hold strong and tighten supply of some high-end chips, joining rivals in benefiting from a solid rebound in the battered global memory chip market.
articles.web: Samsung says AI to drive technology demand in second half after strong Q1

articles.basic_headline: New ASML boss Fouquet must navigate US/China chip war
articles.title: New ASML boss Fouquet must navigate US/China chip war
articles.description: ASML's new boss Christophe Fouquet faces a tricky balancing act in helping to steer Europe's biggest tech company through the US/China "chip war", while maintaining the group's lead over rivals and managing the current AI boom.
articles.web: New ASML boss Fouquet must navigate US/China chip war

thumbnail.caption: Newly appointed President and CEO of Dutch chip machine maker ASML Christophe Fouquet poses for a picture in Veldhoven, Netherlands January 24, 2024. REUTERS/Piroschka van de Wouw/File Photo

thumbnail.subtitle: ASML publishes Q4 results

articles.basic_headline: Western Digital tops profit expectations on demand from cloud-computing customers
articles.title: Western Digital tops profit expectations on demand from cloud-computing customers
articles.description: Western Digital surpassed expectations for quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, riding on a surge in demand for its data storage products from cloud service providers.
articles.web: Western Digital tops profit expectations on demand from cloud-computing customers

articles.basic_headline: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix expects full chip recovery after strong earnings on AI boom
articles.title: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix expects full chip recovery after strong earnings on AI boom
articles.description: South Korea's SK Hynix Inc said it expected a full recovery in memory chips on AI demand, posting its highest profit in nearly two years on sales of advanced DRAM chips with high bandwidth memory (HBM) for use in generative AI chipsets.
articles.web: Nvidia supplier SK Hynix expects full chip recovery after strong earnings on AI boom

articles.basic_headline: Caltech resolves lawsuit against HP over Wi-Fi patents
articles.title: Caltech resolves lawsuit against HP over Wi-Fi patents
articles.description: The California Institute of Technology has agreed to drop its lawsuit accusing HP Inc of infringing patents related to wireless communications, according to a filing in Texas federal court.
articles.web: Caltech resolves lawsuit against HP over Wi-Fi patents

articles.basic_headline: Teradyne sees strong Q2 results on steady chip-testing equipment demand
articles.title: Teradyne sees strong Q2 results on steady chip-testing equipment demand
articles.description: Semiconductor-testing equipment maker Teradyne forecast second-quarter profit and revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, helped by strong demand for its chip-testing equipment.
articles.web: Teradyne sees strong Q2 results on steady chip-testing equipment demand

articles.basic_headline: Apple's Q1 smartphone shipments in China tumble 19%, data shows
articles.title: Apple's Q1 smartphone shipments in China tumble 19%, data shows
articles.description: Apple's smartphone shipments in China tumbled 19% in the first quarter of the year, the worst performance since 2020, as the iPhone maker took a hit from Huawei's (HWT.UL) new product launches in the premium segment, market data showed.
articles.web: Apple's Q1 smartphone shipments in China tumble 19%, data shows

thumbnail.caption: People look at the new iPhone 15 Pro as Apple's new iPhone 15 officially goes on sale across China at an Apple store in Shanghai, China September 22, 2023. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo

articles.basic_headline: Floods swamp southern China, spark extreme weather fears
articles.title: Floods swamp southern China, spark extreme weather fears
articles.description: Floods swamped cities in southern China's densely populated Pearl River Delta following record-breaking rains, sparking worries about the region's defences against bigger deluges induced by extreme weather events.
articles.web: Floods swamp southern China, spark extreme weather fears

thumbnail.caption: A drone view shows roads submerged in floodwaters following heavy rainfall, in Qingyuan, Guangdong province, China April 22. REUTERS/Tingshu Wang
thumbnail.alt_text: Drone view shows roads submerged in floodwaters following heavy rainfall,in Qingyuan
thumbnail.subtitle: Drone view shows roads submerged in floodwaters following heavy rainfall,in Qingyuan
